Name: Clothing Refashionator
Description:
Upgrades Snazzy Suits into Primo Garb.  Duplicants will not fabricate items unless recipes are queued.
 Allows skilled Duplicants to add extra personal pizzazz to their wardrobe.

Name: Textile Loom
Description:
Tailors Duplicant Clothing items.  Duplicants will not fabricate items unless recipes are queued.
 A textile loom can be used to spin Reed Fiber into wearable Duplicant clothing.

Name: Electric Grill
Description:
Cooks a wide variety of improved Foods.  Duplicants will not fabricate items unless recipes are queued.
 Proper cooking eliminates foodborne disease and produces tasty, stress-relieving meals.

Name: Crafting Station
Description:
Produces items and equipment for Duplicant use.  Duplicants will not fabricate items unless recipes are queued.
 Crafting stations allow Duplicants to make oxygen masks to wear in low breathability areas.

Name: Diamond Press
Description:
Uses Power and Radbolts to crush Refined Carbon into Diamond.  Duplicants will not fabricate items unless recipes are queued and Refined Carbon has been discovered.
 Crushes refined carbon into diamond.

Name: Glass Forge
Description:
Produces Molten Glass from raw Sand.  Outputs High Temperature Liquid.  Duplicants will not fabricate items unless recipes are queued.
 Glass can be used to construct window tile.

Name: Gas Range
Description:
Cooks a wide variety of quality Foods.  Duplicants will not fabricate items unless recipes are queued.
 Luxury meals increase Duplicants morale and prevents them from becoming stressed.

Name: Kiln
Description:
Fires Clay to produce Ceramic.  Duplicants will not fabricate items unless recipes are queued.
 Kilns can also be used to refine coal into pure carbon.

Name: Manual Radbolt Generator
Description:
Refines radioactive ores to generate Radbolts.  Emits generated Radbolts in the direction of your choosing.
 Radbolts are necessary for producing Materials Science research.

Name: Metal Refinery
Description:
Produces Refined Metals from raw Metal Ore.  Significantly Heats and outputs the Liquid piped into it.  Duplicants will not fabricate items unless recipes are queued.
 Refined metals are necessary to build advanced electronics and technologies.

Name: Microbe Musher
Description:
Produces low quality Food using common ingredients.  Duplicants will not fabricate items unless recipes are queued.
 Musher recipes will keep Duplicants fed, but may impact health and morale over time.

Name: Orbital Data Collection Lab
Description:
Creates Data Banks that can be consumed at a Virtual Planetarium to unlock new technologies.  Consumes Plastic and Power.
 Orbital Data Collection Labs record data while orbiting a Planetoid and write it to a Data Bank

Name: Rock Crusher
Description:
Inefficiently produces refined materials from raw resources.  Duplicants will not fabricate items unless recipes are queued.
 Rock Crushers loosen nuggets from raw ore and can process many different resources.

Name: Sludge Press
Description:
Separates Mud and other sludges into their base elements.  Duplicants will not fabricate items unless recipes are queued.
 What Duplicant doesn't love playing with mud?

Name: Exosuit Forge
Description:
Forges protective Exosuits for Duplicants to wear.  Duplicants will not fabricate items unless recipes are queued.
 Exosuits can be filled with oxygen to allow Duplicants to safely enter hazardous areas.

Name: Molecular Forge
Description:
Processes Rare Materials into advanced industrial goods.  Rare materials can be retrieved from space missions.  Duplicants will not fabricate items unless recipes are queued.
 Rare materials can be procured through rocket missions into space.

Name: Uranium Centrifuge
Description:
Extracts Enriched Uranium from Uranium Ore.  Outputs Depleted Uranium in molten form.
 Enriched uranium is a specialized substance that can be used to fuel powerful research reactors.

Name: Apothecary
Description:
Produces Medicine to cure most basic Diseases.  Duplicants must possess the Medicine Compounding Skill to fabricate medicines.  Duplicants will not fabricate items unless recipes are queued.
 Some medications help prevent diseases, while others aim to alleviate existing illness.

Name: Egg Cracker
Description:
Converts viable Critter eggs into cooking ingredients.  Cracked Eggs cannot hatch.  Duplicants will not crack eggs unless tasks are queued.
 Raw eggs are an ingredient in certain high quality food recipes.

Name: Ladder
Description:
Enables vertical mobility for Duplicants.
 (That means they climb it.)

Name: Fire Pole
Description:
Allows rapid Duplicant descent.  Significantly slows upward climbing.
 Build these in addition to ladders for efficient upward and downward movement.

Name: Plastic Ladder
Description:
Increases Duplicant climbing speed.
 Plastic ladders are mildly antiseptic and can help limit the spread of germs in a colony.

Name: Tile
Description:
Used to build the walls and floors of rooms.  Increases Duplicant runspeed.
 Tile can be used to bridge gaps and get to unreachable areas.

Name: Airflow Tile
Description:
Used to build the walls and floors of rooms.  Blocks Liquid flow without obstructing Gas.
 Building with airflow tile promotes better gas circulation within a colony.

Name: Mesh Tile
Description:
Used to build the walls and floors of rooms.  Does not obstruct Liquid or Gas flow.
 Mesh tile can be used to make Duplicant pathways in areas where liquid flows.

Name: Insulated Tile
Description:
Used to build the walls and floors of rooms.  Reduces Heat transfer between walls, retaining ambient heat in an area.
 The low thermal conductivity of insulated tiles slows any heat passing through them.

Name: Plastic Tile
Description:
Used to build the walls and floors of rooms.  Significantly increases Duplicant runspeed.
 Plastic tile is mildly antiseptic and can help limit the spread of germs in a colony.

Name: Metal Tile
Description:
Used to build the walls and floors of rooms.  Significantly increases Duplicant runspeed.
 Heat travels much more quickly through metal tile than other types of flooring.

Name: Window Tile
Description:
Used to build the walls and floors of rooms.  Allows Light and Decor to pass through.
 Window tiles provide a barrier against liquid and gas and are completely transparent.

Name: Bunker Tile
Description:
Used to build the walls and floors of rooms.  Can withstand extreme pressures and impacts.
 Bunker tile can build strong shelters in otherwise dangerous environments.

Name: Carpeted Tile
Description:
Used to build the walls and floors of rooms.  Increases Decor, contributing to Morale.
 Soft on little Duplicant toesies.

Name: Mini-Pod
Description:
A portable bioprinter that produces new Duplicants or care packages containing resources.  Only one Printing Pod or Mini-Pod is permitted per Planetoid.
 A quick and easy substitute, though it'll never live up to the original.

Name: Pneumatic Door
Description:
Encloses areas without blocking Liquid or Gas flow.  Wild Critters cannot pass through doors.
 Door controls can be used to prevent Duplicants from entering restricted areas.

Name: Manual Airlock
Description:
Blocks Liquid and Gas flow, maintaining pressure between areas.  Wild Critters cannot pass through doors.
 Airlocks can quarter off dangerous areas and prevent gases from seeping into the colony.

Name: Mechanized Airlock
Description:
Blocks Liquid and Gas flow, maintaining pressure between areas.  Functions as a Manual Airlock when no Power is available.  Wild Critters cannot pass through doors.
 Mechanized airlocks open and close more quickly than other types of door.

Name: Bunker Door
Description:
Blocks Liquid and Gas flow, maintaining pressure between areas.  Can withstand extremely high pressures and impacts.
 A massive, slow-moving door which is nearly indestructible.

Name: Storage Bin
Description:
Stores the Solid Materials of your choosing.
 Resources left on the floor become "debris" and lower decor when not put away.

Name: Smart Storage Bin
Description: Stores the Solid Materials of your choosing. Sends a Green Signal when bin is full. Smart storage bins can automate resource organization based on type and mass.

Name: Liquid Reservoir
Description:
Stores any Liquid resources piped into it.
 Reservoirs cannot receive manually delivered resources.

Name: Gas Reservoir
Description:
Stores any Gas resources piped into it.
 Reservoirs cannot receive manually delivered resources.

Name: Automatic Dispenser
Description: Stores any Solid Materials delivered to it by Duplicants. Dumps stored materials back into the world when it receives a Green Signal. Automatic dispensers will store and drop resources in small quantities.

Name: Transit Tube
Description:
Quickly transports Duplicants from a Transit Tube Access to the tube's end.  Only transports Duplicants.
 Duplicants will only exit a transit tube when a safe landing area is available beneath it.

Name: Transit Tube Access
Description:
Allows Duplicants to enter the connected Transit Tube system.  Stops drawing Power once fully charged.
 Duplicants require access points to enter tubes, but not to exit them.

Name: Transit Tube Crossing
Description:
Allows Transit Tubes to be run through wall and floor tile.  Functions as regular tile.
 Tube crossings can run transit tubes through walls without leaking gas or liquid.

Name: Oxygen Diffuser
Description:
Converts large amounts of Algae into Oxygen.  Becomes idle when the area reaches maximum pressure capacity.
 Oxygen diffusers are inefficient, but output enough oxygen to keep a colony breathing.

Name: Sublimation Station
Description:
Speeds up the conversion of Polluted Dirt into Polluted Oxygen.  Becomes idle when the area reaches maximum pressure capacity.
 Sublimation is the sublime process by which solids convert directly into gas.

Name: Algae Terrarium
Description:
Consumes Algae to produce Oxygen and remove some Carbon Dioxide.  Gains a 10% efficiency boost in direct Light.
 Algae colony, Duplicant colony... we're more alike than we are different.

Name: Deodorizer
Description:
Uses Sand to filter Polluted Oxygen from the air, reducing Disease spread.
 Oh! Citrus scented!

Name: Carbon Skimmer
Description:
Uses Water to filter Carbon Dioxide from the air.
 Skimmers remove large amounts of carbon dioxide, but produce no breathable air.

Name: Electrolyzer
Description:
Converts Water into Oxygen and Hydrogen.  Becomes idle when the area reaches maximum pressure capacity.
 Water goes in one end, life sustaining oxygen comes out the other.

Name: Rust Deoxidizer
Description:
Converts Rust into Oxygen and Chlorine.  Becomes idle when the area reaches maximum pressure capacity.
 Rust and salt goes in, oxygen comes out.

Name: Manual Generator
Description:
Converts manual labor into electrical Power.
 Watching Duplicants run on it is adorable... the electrical power is just an added bonus.

Name: Coal Generator
Description:
Converts Coal into electrical Power.  Produces Carbon Dioxide.
 Burning coal produces more energy than manual power, but emits heat and exhaust.

Name: Wood Burner
Description:
Burns Lumber to produce electrical Power.  Produces Carbon Dioxide and Heat.
 Wood burners are small and easy to maintain, but produce a fair amount of heat.

Name: Hydrogen Generator
Description:
Converts Hydrogen into electrical Power.
 Hydrogen generators are extremely efficient, emitting next to no waste.

Name: Natural Gas Generator
Description:
Converts Natural Gas into electrical Power.  Produces Carbon Dioxide and Polluted Water.
 Natural gas generators leak polluted water and are best built above a waste reservoir.

Name: Petroleum Generator
Description:
Converts either Petroleum or Ethanol into electrical Power.  Produces Carbon Dioxide and Polluted Water.
 Petroleum generators have a high energy output but produce a great deal of waste.

Name: Steam Turbine
Description:
Draws in Steam from the tiles directly below the machine's foundation and uses it to generate electrical Power.  Outputs Water.
 Useful for converting the geothermal energy into usable power.

Name: Solar Panel
Description:
Converts Sunlight into electrical Power.  Must be exposed to space.
 Solar panels convert high intensity sunlight into power and produce zero waste.

Name: Wire
Description:
Connects buildings to Power sources.  Can be run through wall and floor tile.
 Electrical wire is used to connect generators, batteries, and buildings.

Name: Wire Bridge
Description:
Runs one wire section over another without joining them.  Can be run through wall and floor tile.
 Splitting generators onto separate grids can prevent overloads and wasted electricity.

Name: Heavi-Watt Wire
Description:
Carries more Wattage than regular Wire without overloading.  Cannot be run through wall and floor tile.
 Higher wattage wire is used to avoid power overloads, particularly for strong generators.

Name: Heavi-Watt Joint Plate
Description:
Allows Heavi-Watt Wire to be run through wall and floor tile.  Functions as regular tile.
 Joint plates can run Heavi-Watt wires through walls without leaking gas or liquid.

Name: Conductive Wire
Description:
Connects buildings to Power sources.  Can be run through wall and floor tile.
 My Duplicants prefer the look of conductive wire to the regular raggedy stuff.

Name: Conductive Wire Bridge
Description:
Carries more Wattage than a regular Wire Bridge without overloading.  Runs one wire section over another without joining them.  Can be run through wall and floor tile.
 Splitting generators onto separate systems can prevent overloads and wasted electricity.

Name: Heavi-Watt Conductive Wire
Description:
Carries more Wattage than regular Wire without overloading.  Cannot be run through wall and floor tile.
 Higher wattage wire is used to avoid power overloads, particularly for strong generators.

Name: Heavi-Watt Conductive Joint Plate
Description:
Carries more Wattage than a regular Heavi-Watt Joint Plate without overloading.  Allows Heavi-Watt Wire to be run through wall and floor tile.
 Joint plates can run Heavi-Watt wires through walls without leaking gas or liquid.

Name: Battery
Description:
Stores Power from generators, then provides that power to buildings.  Loses charge over time.
 Batteries allow power from generators to be stored for later.

Name: Jumbo Battery
Description:
Stores Power from generators, then provides that power to buildings.  Slightly loses charge over time.
 Larger batteries hold more power and keep systems running longer before recharging.

Name: Smart Battery
Description: Stores Power from generators, then provides that power to buildings. Sends a Green Signal or Red Signal based on the configuration of the Logic Activation Parameters. Very slightly loses charge over time. Smart batteries send a Green Signal when they require charging.

Name: Power Transformer
Description:
Limits Power flowing through the Transformer to 1000 W.  Connect Batteries on the large side to act as a valve and prevent Wires from drawing more than 1000 W.  Can be rotated before construction.
 Limiting the power drawn by wires prevents them from incurring overload damage.

Name: Large Power Transformer
Description:
Limits Power flowing through the Transformer to 4 kW.  Connect Batteries on the large side to act as a valve and prevent Wires from drawing more than 4 kW.  Can be rotated before construction.
 Limiting the power drawn by wires prevents them from incurring overload damage.

Name: Switch
Description:
Turns Power on or off.  Does not affect circuitry preceding the switch.
 Switches can only affect buildings that come after them on a circuit.

Name: Power Shutoff
Description:
Connects to an Automation grid to automatically turn Power on or off.  Does not affect circuitry preceding the switch.
 Automated systems save power and time by removing the need for Duplicant input.

Name: Planter Box
Description:
Grows one Plant from a Seed.
 Domestically grown seeds mature more quickly than wild plants.

Name: Farm Tile
Description:
Grows one Plant from a Seed.  Can be used as floor tile and rotated before construction.
 Duplicants can deliver fertilizer and liquids to farm tiles, accelerating plant growth.

Name: Hydroponic Farm
Description:
Grows one Plant from a Seed.  Can be used as floor tile and rotated before construction.  Must be irrigated through Liquid Piping.
 Hydroponic farms reduce Duplicant traffic by automating irrigating crops.

Name: Ration Box
Description:
Stores a small amount of Food.  Food must be delivered to boxes by Duplicants.
 Ration boxes keep food safe from hungry critters, but don't slow food spoilage.

Name: Refrigerator
Description:
Stores Food at an ideal Temperature to prevent spoilage.
 Food spoilage can be slowed by ambient conditions as well as by refrigerators.

Name: Critter Drop-Off
Description:
Releases trapped Critters back into the world.  Can be used multiple times.
 Duplicants automatically bring captured critters to these relocation points for release.

Name: Fish Release
Description:
Releases trapped Pacu back into the world.  Can be used multiple times.
 A fish release must be built above liquid to prevent released fish from suffocating.

Name: Critter Feeder
Description:
Automatically dispenses food for hungry Critters.
 Critters tend to stay close to their food source and wander less when given a feeder.

Name: Fish Feeder
Description:
Automatically dispenses stored Critter food into the area below.  Dispenses once per day.
 Build this feeder above a body of water to feed the fish within.

Name: Incubator
Description:
Incubates Critter eggs until ready to hatch.  Assigned Duplicants must possess the Critter Ranching .
 Incubators can maintain the ideal internal conditions for several species of critter egg.

Name: Critter Trap
Description:
Captures a living Critter for transport.  Single use.
 Critter traps cannot catch swimming or flying critters.

Name: Fish Trap
Description:
Attracts and traps swimming Pacu.  Single use.
 Trapped fish will automatically be bagged for transport.

Name: Airborne Critter Bait
Description:
Attracts one type of airborne critter.  Single use.
 The type of critter attracted by critter bait depends on the construction material.

Name: Outhouse
Description:
Gives Duplicants a place to relieve themselves.  Requires no Piping.  Must be periodically emptied of Polluted Dirt.
 The colony that eats together, excretes together.

Name: Lavatory
Description:
Gives Duplicants a place to relieve themselves.  Spreads very few Germs.
 Lavatories transmit fewer germs to Duplicants' skin and require no emptying.

Name: Wall Toilet
Description:
Gives Duplicants a place to relieve themselves. Empties directly on the other side of the wall.  Spreads very few Germs.
 Wall Toilets transmit fewer germs to Duplicants and require no emptying.

Name: Shower
Description:
Improves Duplicant Morale and removes surface Germs.
 Regularly showering will prevent Duplicants spreading germs to the things they touch.

Name: Pitcher Pump
Description:
Manually pumps Liquid into bottles for transport.  Duplicants can only carry liquids that are bottled.
 Pitcher pumps allow Duplicants to bottle and deliver liquids from place to place.

Name: Bottle Emptier
Description:
Empties bottled Liquids back into the world.
 A bottle emptier's Element Filter can be used to designate areas for specific liquid storage.

Name: Liquid Pipe
Description:
Carries Liquid between Outputs and Intakes.  Can be run through wall and floor tile.
 Liquid pipes are used to connect the inputs and outputs of plumbed buildings.

Name: Insulated Liquid Pipe
Description:
Carries Liquid with minimal change in Temperature.  Can be run through wall and floor tile.
 Pipe insulation prevents liquid contents from significantly changing temperature in transit.

Name: Radiant Liquid Pipe
Description:
Carries Liquid, allowing extreme Temperature exchange with the surrounding environment.  Can be run through wall and floor tile.
 Radiant pipes pumping cold liquid can be run through hot areas to help cool them down.

Name: Liquid Bridge
Description:
Runs one Liquid Pipe section over another without joining them.  Can be run through wall and floor tile.
 Separate pipe systems help prevent building damage caused by mingled pipe contents.

Name: Liquid Pump
Description:
Draws in Liquid and runs it through Pipes.  Must be submerged in Liquid.
 Piping a pump's output to a building's intake will send liquid to that building.

Name: Mini Liquid Pump
Description:
Draws in a small amount of Liquid and runs it through Pipes.  Must be submerged in Liquid.
 Mini pumps are useful for moving small quantities of liquid with minimum power.

Name: Liquid Vent
Description:
Releases Liquid from Liquid Pipes.
 Vents are an exit point for liquids from plumbing systems.

Name: Liquid Filter
Description:
Sieves one Liquid out of a mix, sending it into a dedicated Filtered Output Pipe.  Can only filter one liquid type at a time.
 All liquids are sent into the building's output pipe, except the liquid chosen for filtering.

Name: Liquid Valve
Description:
Controls the Liquid volume permitted through Pipes.
 Valves control the amount of liquid that moves through pipes, preventing waste.

Name: Liquid Shutoff
Description:
Connects to an Automation grid to automatically turn Liquid flow on or off.
 Automated piping saves power and time by removing the need for Duplicant input.

Name: Liquid Meter Valve
Description:
Connects to an Automation grid to automatically turn Liquid flow off when the specified amount has passed through it.
 Meter Valves let an exact amount of liquid pass through before shutting off.

Name: Liquid Pipe Element Sensor
Description: Sends a Green Signal when the selected Liquid is detected within a pipe. Element sensors can be used to detect the presence of a specific liquid in a pipe.

Name: Liquid Pipe Germ Sensor
Description: Sends a Green Signal or a Red Signal based on the internal Germ count of the pipe. Germ sensors can help control automation behavior in the presence of germs.

Name: Liquid Pipe Thermo Sensor
Description: Sends a Green Signal or a Red Signal when pipe contents enter the chosen Temperature range. Thermo sensors disable buildings when their pipe contents reach a certain temperature.

Name: Liquid Rocket Port Loader
Description:
Loads Liquids to the storage of a linked rocket.  Automatically links when built to the side of a Rocket Platform or another Rocket Port.  Uses the liquid filters set on the rocket's cargo bays.
 Rockets must be landed to load or unload resources.

Name: Liquid Rocket Port Unloader
Description:
Unloads Liquids from the storage of a linked rocket.  Automatically links when built to the side of a Rocket Platform or another Rocket Port.  Uses the liquid filters set on this unloader.
 Rockets must be landed to load or unload resources.

Name: Gas Pipe
Description:
Carries Gas between Outputs and Intakes.  Can be run through wall and floor tile.
 Gas pipes are used to connect the inputs and outputs of ventilated buildings.

Name: Insulated Gas Pipe
Description:
Carries Gas with minimal change in Temperature.  Can be run through wall and floor tile.
 Pipe insulation prevents gas contents from significantly changing temperature in transit.

Name: Radiant Gas Pipe
Description:
Carries Gas, allowing extreme Temperature exchange with the surrounding environment.  Can be run through wall and floor tile.
 Radiant pipes pumping cold gas can be run through hot areas to help cool them down.

Name: Gas Bridge
Description:
Runs one Gas Pipe section over another without joining them.  Can be run through wall and floor tile.
 Separate pipe systems prevent mingled contents from causing building damage.

Name: Gas Pump
Description:
Draws in Gas and runs it through Pipes.  Must be immersed in Gas.
 Piping a pump's output to a building's intake will send gas to that building.

Name: Mini Gas Pump
Description:
Draws in a small amount of Gas and runs it through Pipes.  Must be immersed in Gas.
 Mini pumps are useful for moving small quantities of gas with minimum power.

Name: Gas Vent
Description:
Releases Gas from Gas Pipes.
 Vents are an exit point for gases from ventilation systems.

Name: High Pressure Gas Vent
Description:
Releases Gas from Gas Pipes into high pressure locations.
 High pressure vents can expel gas into more highly pressurized environments.

Name: Gas Filter
Description:
Sieves one Gas from the air, sending it into a dedicated Pipe.
 All gases are sent into the building's output pipe, except the gas chosen for filtering.

Name: Gas Valve
Description:
Controls the Gas volume permitted through Pipes.
 Valves control the amount of gas that moves through pipes, preventing waste.

Name: Gas Shutoff
Description:
Connects to an Automation grid to automatically turn Gas flow on or off.
 Automated piping saves power and time by removing the need for Duplicant input.

Name: Gas Meter Valve
Description:
Connects to an Automation grid to automatically turn Gas flow off when the specified amount has passed through it.
 Meter Valves let an exact amount of gas pass through before shutting off.

Name: Canister Filler
Description:
Automatically stores piped Gases into canisters for manual transport.
 Canisters allow Duplicants to manually deliver gases from place to place.

Name: Canister Emptier
Description:
Empties Gas canisters back into the world.
 A canister emptier's Element Filter can designate areas for specific gas storage.

Name: Gas Rocket Port Loader
Description:
Loads Gases to the storage of a linked rocket.  Automatically links when built to the side of a Rocket Platform or another Rocket Port.  Uses the gas filters set on the rocket's cargo bays.
 Rockets must be landed to load or unload resources.

Name: Gas Rocket Port Unloader
Description:
Unloads Gases from the storage of a linked rocket.  Automatically links when built to the side of a Rocket Platform or another Rocket Port.  Uses the gas filters set on this unloader.
 Rockets must be landed to load or unload resources.

Name: Gas Pipe Element Sensor
Description: Sends a Green Signal when the selected Gas is detected within a pipe. Element sensors can be used to detect the presence of a specific gas in a pipe.

Name: Gas Pipe Germ Sensor
Description: Sends a Green Signal or a Red Signal based on the internal Germ count of the pipe. Germ sensors can help control automation behavior in the presence of germs.

Name: Gas Pipe Thermo Sensor
Description: Sends a Green Signal or a Red Signal when pipe contents enter the chosen Temperature range. Thermo sensors disable buildings when their pipe contents reach a certain temperature.

Name: Compost
Description:
Reduces Polluted Dirt and other compostables down into Dirt.
 Composts safely deal with biological waste, producing fresh dirt.

Name: Water Sieve
Description:
Produces clean Water from Polluted Water using Sand.  Produces Polluted Dirt.
 Sieves cannot kill germs and pass any they receive into their waste and water output.

Name: Desalinator
Description:
Removes Salt from Brine or Salt Water, producing Water.
 Salt can be refined into table salt for a mealtime morale boost.

Name: Fertilizer Synthesizer
Description:
Uses Polluted Water and Phosphorite to produce Fertilizer.
 Fertilizer synthesizers convert polluted dirt into fertilizer for domestic plants.

Name: Algae Distiller
Description:
Refines Slime into Algae.
 Algae distillers convert disease-causing slime into algae for oxygen production.

Name: Ethanol Distiller
Description:
Refines Lumber into Ethanol.
 Ethanol distillers convert Lumber into burnable Ethanol fuel.

Name: Oil Refinery
Description:
Converts Crude Oil into Petroleum and Natural Gas.
 Petroleum can only be produced from the refinement of crude oil.

Name: Polymer Press
Description:
Converts Petroleum into raw Plastic.
 Plastic can be used to craft unique buildings and goods.

Name: Oxylite Refinery
Description:
Synthesizes Oxylite using Oxygen and a small amount of Gold.
 Oxylite is a solid and easily transportable source of consumable oxygen.

Name: Wash Basin
Description:
Removes some Germs from Duplicants.  Germ-covered Duplicants use Wash Basins when passing by in the selected direction.
 Germ spread can be reduced by building these where Duplicants often get dirty.

Name: Sink
Description:
Removes Germs from Duplicants.  Germ-covered Duplicants use Sinks when passing by in the selected direction.
 Sinks are plumbed and do not need to be manually emptied or refilled.

Name: Hand Sanitizer
Description:
Removes most Germs from Duplicants.  Germ-covered Duplicants use Hand Sanitizers when passing by in the selected direction.
 Hand sanitizers kill germs more effectively than wash basins.

Name: Decontamination Shower
Description:
Uses Water to remove Germs and Radiation.  Decontaminates both Duplicants and their Clothing.
 Don't forget to decontaminate behind your ears.

Name: Sick Bay
Description:
Allows Duplicants to administer basic treatments to sick Duplicants.  Duplicants must possess the Bedside Manner Skill to treat peers.
 Sick bays can be placed in hospital rooms to decrease the likelihood of disease spreading.

Name: Disease Clinic
Description:
Allows Duplicants to administer powerful treatments to sick Duplicants.  Duplicants must possess the Advanced Medical Care Skill to treat peers.
 Disease clinics require power, but treat more serious illnesses than sick bays alone.

Name: Triage Cot
Description:
Accelerates Health restoration and the healing of physical injuries.  Revives incapacitated Duplicants.
 Duplicants use triage cots to recover from physical injuries and receive aid from peers.

Name: Massage Table
Description:
Rapidly reduces Stress for the Duplicant user.  Duplicants will automatically seek a massage table when Stress exceeds breaktime range.
 Massage tables quickly reduce extreme stress, at the cost of power production.

Name: Tasteful Memorial
Description:
Provides a final resting place for deceased Duplicants.  Living Duplicants will automatically place an unburied corpse inside.
 Burying dead Duplicants reduces health hazards and stress on the colony.

Name: Cot
Description:
Gives one Duplicant a place to sleep.  Duplicants will automatically return to their cots to sleep at night.
 Duplicants without a bed will develop sore backs from sleeping on the floor.

Name: Comfy Bed
Description:
Provides a sleeping area for one Duplicant and restores additional Stamina.  Duplicants will automatically sleep in their assigned beds at night.
 Duplicants prefer comfy beds to cots and gain more stamina from sleeping in them.

Name: Ladder Bed
Description:
Provides a sleeping area for one Duplicant and also functions as a ladder.  Duplicants will automatically sleep in their assigned beds at night.
 Duplicant's sleep will be interrupted if another Duplicant uses the ladder.

Name: Lamp
Description:
Provides Light when Powered.  Increases Duplicant workspeed within light radius.
 Any building's light emitting radius can be viewed in the light overlay.

Name: Ceiling Light
Description:
Provides Light when Powered.  Increases Duplicant workspeed within light radius.
 Light reduces Duplicant stress and is required to grow certain plants.

Name: Sun Lamp
Description:
Gives off Sunlight level Lux.  Can be paired with Beach Chairs.
 An artificial ray of sunshine.

Name: Mess Table
Description:
Gives one Duplicant a place to eat.  Duplicants will automatically eat at their assigned table when hungry.
 Duplicants prefer to dine at a table, rather than eat off the floor.

Name: Water Cooler
Description:
Provides a gathering place for Duplicants during Downtime.  Improves Duplicant Morale.
 Chatting with friends improves Duplicants' moods and reduces their stress.

Name: Jukebot
Description:
Plays music for Duplicants to dance to on their breaks.  Increases Duplicant Morale.
 Dancing helps Duplicants get their innermost feelings out.

Name: Arcade Cabinet
Description:
Allows Duplicants to play video games on their breaks.  Increases Duplicant Morale.
 Komet Kablam-O!For up to two players.

Name: Espresso Machine
Description:
Provides refreshment for Duplicants on their breaks.  Increases Duplicant Morale.
 A shot of espresso helps Duplicants relax after a long day.

Name: Hot Tub
Description:
Requires Pipes to and from tub and Power to run the jets.  Water must be a comfortable temperature and will cool rapidly.  Increases Duplicant Morale.
 Relaxes Duplicants with massaging jets of heated liquid.

Name: Mechanical Surfboard
Description:
Increases Duplicant Morale.  Some Water gets splashed on the floor during use.
 Mechanical waves make for radical relaxation time.

Name: Sauna
Description:
Uses Steam to create a relaxing atmosphere.  Increases Duplicant Morale.
 A steamy sauna soothes away all the aches and pains.

Name: Juicer
Description:
Provides refreshment for Duplicants on their breaks.  Drinking juice increases Duplicant Morale.
 Fruity juice can really brighten a Duplicant's breaktime

Name: Soda Fountain
Description:
Creates soda from Water and Carbon Dioxide.  Consuming soda water increases Duplicant Morale.
 Sparkling water puts a twinkle in a Duplicant's eye.

Name: Beach Chair
Description:
Duplicants can relax by lounging in Sunlight.  Increases Duplicant Morale.
 Soak up some relaxing sun rays.

Name: Vertical Wind Tunnel
Description:
Must be connected to a Power Source. To properly function, the area under this building must be left vacant.  Increases Duplicants Morale.
 Duplicants love the feeling of high-powered wind through their hair.

Name: Pixel Pack
Description: Pixels can be designated a color when it receives a Green Signal and a different color when it receives a Red Signal. Input from an Automation Wire controls the whole strip. Input from an Automation Ribbon can control individual pixels on the strip. Four pixels which can be individually designated different colors.

Name: Party Line Phone
Description:
Can be used by one Duplicant to chat with themselves or with other Duplicants in different locations.  Chatting increases Duplicant Morale.
 You never know who you'll meet on the other line.

Name: Flower Pot
Description:
Houses a single Plant when sown with a Seed.  Increases Decor, contributing to Morale.
 Flower pots allow decorative plants to be moved to new locations.

Name: Wall Pot
Description:
Houses a single Plant when sown with a Seed.  Increases Decor, contributing to Morale.  Must be hung from a wall.
 Placing a plant in a wall pot can add a spot of Decor to otherwise bare walls.

Name: Hanging Pot
Description:
Houses a single Plant when sown with a Seed.  Increases Decor, contributing to Morale.  Must be hung from a ceiling.
 Hanging pots can add some Decor to a room, without blocking buildings on the floor.

Name: Aero Pot
Description:
Houses a single Plant when sown with a Seed.  Increases Decor, contributing to Morale.  Must be hung from a ceiling.
 Aero pots can be hung from the ceiling and have extremely high Decor.

Name: Sculpting Block
Description:
Minorly increases Decor, contributing to Morale.  Must be sculpted by a Duplicant.
 Duplicants who have learned art skills can produce more decorative sculptures.

Name: Large Sculpting Block
Description:
Moderately increases Decor, contributing to Morale.  Must be sculpted by a Duplicant.
 Duplicants who have learned art skills can produce more decorative sculptures.

Name: Ice Block
Description:
Majorly increases Decor, contributing to Morale.  Must be sculpted by a Duplicant.
 Prone to melting.

Name: Marble Block
Description:
Majorly increases Decor, contributing to Morale.  Must be sculpted by a Duplicant.
 Duplicants who have learned art skills can produce more decorative sculptures.

Name: Metal Block
Description:
Majorly increases Decor, contributing to Morale.  Must be sculpted by a Duplicant.
 Duplicants who have learned art skills can produce more decorative sculptures.

Name: Crown Moulding
Description:
Used to decorate the ceilings of rooms.  Increases Decor, contributing to Morale.
 Crown moulding is used as purely decorative trim for ceilings.

Name: Corner Moulding
Description:
Used to decorate the ceiling corners of rooms.  Increases Decor, contributing to Morale.
 Corner moulding is used as purely decorative trim for ceiling corners.

Name: Blank Canvas
Description:
Increases Decor, contributing to Morale.  Must be painted by a Duplicant.
 Once built, a Duplicant can paint a blank canvas to produce a decorative painting.

Name: Landscape Canvas
Description:
Moderately increases Decor, contributing to Morale.  Must be painted by a Duplicant.
 Once built, a Duplicant can paint a blank canvas to produce a decorative painting.

Name: Portrait Canvas
Description:
Moderately increases Decor, contributing to Morale.  Must be painted by a Duplicant.
 Once built, a Duplicant can paint a blank canvas to produce a decorative painting.

Name: Pedestal
Description:
Displays a single object, doubling its Decor value.  Objects with negative Decor will gain some positive Decor when displayed.
 Perception can be drastically changed by a bit of thoughtful presentation.

Name: Monument Base
Description:
Builds the bottom section of a Great Monument.  Can be customized.  A Great Monument must be built to achieve the Colonize Imperative.
 The base of a monument must be constructed first.

Name: Monument Midsection
Description:
Builds the middle section of a Great Monument.  Can be customized.  A Great Monument must be built to achieve the Colonize Imperative.
 Customized sections of a Great Monument can be mixed and matched.

Name: Monument Top
Description:
Builds the top section of a Great Monument.  Can be customized.  A Great Monument must be built to achieve the Colonize Imperative.
 Building a Great Monument will declare to the universe that this hunk of rock is your own.

Name: Park Sign
Description:
Classifies an area as a Park or Nature Reserve.
 Passing through parks will increase Duplicant Morale.

Name: Research Station
Description:
Conducts Novice Research to unlock new technologies.  Consumes Dirt.
 Research stations are necessary for unlocking all research tiers.

Name: Super Computer
Description:
Conducts Advanced Research to unlock new technologies.  Consumes Water.  Assigned Duplicants must possess the Advanced Research skill.
 Super computers unlock higher technology tiers than research stations alone.

Name: Materials Study Terminal
Description:
Conducts Materials Science Research to unlock new technologies.  Consumes Radbolts.  Assigned Duplicants must possess the Applied Sciences Research skill.
 Comes with a few ions thrown in, free of charge.

Name: Virtual Planetarium
Description:
Conducts Data Analysis Research to unlock new technologies.  Consumes Data Banks generated by exploration.
 Planetariums allow the simulated exploration of locations recorded in Data Banks.

Name: Power Control Station
Description:
Produces Microchip to increase the Power output of generators.  Assigned Duplicants must possess the Tune Up trait.  This building is a necessary component of the Power Plant room.
 Only one Duplicant may be assigned to a station at a time.

Name: Farm Station
Description:
Produces Micronutrient Fertilizer to increase Plant growth rates.  Assigned Duplicants must possess the Crop Tending trait.  This building is a necessary component of the Greenhouse room.
 This station only has an effect on crops grown within the same room.

Name: Botanical Analyzer
Description:
Identifies new Seed subspecies.
 Would a mutated rose still smell as sweet?

Name: Grooming Station
Description:
Allows the assigned Rancher to care for Critters.  Assigned Duplicants must possess the Critter Ranching skill.  This building is a necessary component of the Stable room.
 Grooming critters make them look nice, smell pretty, feel happy, and produce more.

Name: Shearing Station
Description:
Allows the assigned Rancher to shear Dreckos and Delecta Voles.
 Shearing stations allow Dreckos and Delecta Voles to be safely sheared for useful raw materials.

Name: Skill Scrubber
Description:
Refunds a Duplicant's Skill Points for reassignment.  Duplicants will lose all assigned skills in the process.
 Erase skills from a Duplicant's mind, returning them to their default abilities.

Name: Artifact Analysis Station
Description:
Analyses and extracts Neutronium from artifacts of interest.
 Discover the mysteries of the past.

Name: Oxygen Mask Checkpoint
Description:
Marks a threshold where Duplicants must put on or take off an Oxygen Mask.  Must be built next to an Oxygen Mask Dock.  Can be rotated before construction.
 A checkpoint must have a correlating dock built on the opposite side its arrow faces.

Name: Oxygen Mask Dock
Description:
Stores Oxygen Masks and refuels them with Oxygen.  Build next to an Oxygen Mask Checkpoint to make Duplicants put on masks when passing by.
 An oxygen mask dock will store and refill masks while they're not in use.

Name: Atmo Suit Checkpoint
Description:
Marks a threshold where Duplicants must change into or out of Atmo Suits.  Must be built next to an Atmo Suit Dock.  Can be rotated before construction.
 A checkpoint must have a correlating dock built on the opposite side its arrow faces.

Name: Atmo Suit Dock
Description:
Stores Atmo Suits and refuels them with Oxygen.  Empties suits of Polluted Water.  Build next to an Atmo Suit Checkpoint to make Duplicants change into suits when passing by.
 An atmo suit dock will empty atmo suits of waste, but only one suit can charge at a time.

Name: Jet Suit Checkpoint
Description:
Marks a threshold where Duplicants must change into or out of Jet Suits.  Must be built next to a Jet Suit Dock.  Can be rotated before construction.
 A checkpoint must have a correlating dock built on the opposite side its arrow faces.

Name: Jet Suit Dock
Description:
Stores Jet Suits and refuels them with Oxygen and Petroleum.  Empties suits of Polluted Water.  Build next to a Jet Suit Checkpoint to make Duplicants change into suits when passing by.
 Jet suit docks can refill jet suits with air and fuel, or empty them of waste.

Name: Lead Suit Checkpoint
Description:
Marks a threshold where Duplicants must change into or out of Lead Suits.  Must be built next to a Lead Suit Dock  Can be rotated before construction.
 A checkpoint must have a correlating dock built on the opposite side its arrow faces.

Name: Lead Suit Dock
Description:
Stores Lead Suits and refuels them  with Oxygen.  Empties suits of Polluted Water.  Build next to a Lead Suit Checkpoint to make Duplicants change into suits when passing by.
 Lead suit docks can refill lead suits with air and empty them of waste.

Name: Space Heater
Description:
Radiates a moderate amount of Heat.
 A space heater will radiate heat for as long as it's powered.

Name: Liquid Tepidizer
Description:
Warms large bodies of Liquid.  Must be fully submerged.
 Tepidizers heat liquid which can kill waterborne germs.

Name: Ice-E Fan
Description:
Uses Ice to dissipate a small amount of the Heat.
 A Duplicant can work an Ice-E fan to temporarily cool small areas as needed.

Name: Ice Maker
Description:
Converts Water into Ice.
 Ice makers can be used as a small renewable source of ice.

Name: Thermo Regulator
Description:
Cools the Gas piped through it, but outputs Heat in its immediate vicinity.
 A thermo regulator doesn't remove heat, but relocates it to a new area.

Name: Thermo Aquatuner
Description:
Cools the Liquid piped through it, but outputs Heat in its immediate vicinity.
 A thermo aquatuner cools liquid and outputs the heat elsewhere.

Name: Ore Scrubber
Description:
Kills a significant amount of Germs present on Raw Ore.
 Scrubbers sanitize freshly mined materials before they're brought into the colony.

Name: Oil Well
Description:
Extracts Crude Oil using clean Water.  Must be built atop an Oil Reservoir.
 Water pumped into an oil reservoir cannot be recovered.

Name: Tempshift Plate
Description:
Accelerates or buffers Heat dispersal based on the construction material used.  Has a small area of effect.
 The thermal properties of construction materials determine their heat retention.

Name: Drywall
Description:
Prevents Gas and Liquid loss in space.  Builds an insulating backwall behind buildings.
 Drywall can be used in conjunction with tiles to build airtight rooms on the surface.

Name: Sweepy's Dock
Description:
Deploys an automated Sweepy Bot to sweep up Solid debris and Liquid spills.  Dock stores Liquids and Solids gathered by the Sweepy.  Uses Power to recharge the Sweepy.  Duplicants will empty Dock storage into available storage bins.
 The cute little face comes pre-installed.

Name: Automation Wire
Description:
Connects buildings to Sensors.  Can be run through wall and floor tile.
 Automation wire is used to connect building ports to automation gates.

Name: Automation Wire Bridge
Description:
Runs one Automation Wire section over another without joining them.  Can be run through wall and floor tile.
 Wire bridges allow multiple automation grids to exist in a small area without connecting.

Name: Automation Ribbon
Description:
A 4-Bit Automation Wire which can carry up to four automation signals.  Use a Ribbon Writer to output to multiple Bits, and a Ribbon Reader to input from multiple Bits.
 Logic ribbons use significantly less space to carry multiple automation signals.

Name: Automation Ribbon Bridge
Description:
Runs one Automation Ribbon section over another without joining them.  Can be run through wall and floor tile.
 Wire bridges allow multiple automation grids to exist in a small area without connecting.

Name: Signal Switch
Description: Sends a Green Signal or a Red Signal on an Automation grid. Signal switches don't turn grids on and off like power switches, but add an extra signal.

Name: Duplicant Motion Sensor
Description: Sends a Green Signal or a Red Signal based on whether a Duplicant is in the sensor's range. Motion sensors save power by only enabling buildings when Duplicants are nearby.

Name: Atmo Sensor
Description: Sends a Green Signal or a Red Signal when Gas pressure enters the chosen range. Atmo sensors can be used to prevent excess oxygen production and overpressurization.

Name: Hydro Sensor
Description: Sends a Green Signal or a Red Signal when Liquid pressure enters the chosen range. Must be submerged in Liquid. A hydro sensor can tell a pump to refill its basin as soon as it contains too little liquid.

Name: Thermo Sensor
Description: Sends a Green Signal or a Red Signal when ambient Temperature enters the chosen range. Thermo sensors can disable buildings when they approach dangerous temperatures.

Name: Wattage Sensor
Description: Sends a Green Signal or a Red Signal when Wattage consumed enters the chosen range. Wattage sensors can send a signal when a building has switched on or off.

Name: Cycle Sensor
Description: Sets an automatic Green Signal and Red Signal schedule within one day-night cycle. Cycle sensors ensure systems always turn on at the same time, day or night, every cycle.

Name: Timer Sensor
Description: Creates a timer to send Green Signals and Red Signals for specific amounts of time. Timer sensors create automation schedules for very short or very long periods of time.

Name: Germ Sensor
Description: Sends a Green Signal or a Red Signal based on quantity of surrounding Germs. Detecting germ populations can help block off or clean up dangerous areas.

Name: Gas Element Sensor
Description: Sends a Green Signal when the selected Gas is detected on this sensor's tile. Sends a Red Signal when the selected Gas is not present. These sensors can detect the presence of a specific gas and alter systems accordingly.

Name: Liquid Element Sensor
Description: Sends a Green Signal when the selected Liquid is detected on this sensor's tile. Sends a Red Signal when the selected Liquid is not present. These sensors can detect the presence of a specific liquid and alter systems accordingly.

Name: Critter Sensor
Description: Sends a Green Signal or a Red Signal based on the number of eggs and critters in a room. Detecting critter populations can help adjust their automated feeding and care regimens.

Name: Radiation Sensor
Description: Sends a Green Signal or a Red Signal when ambient Radiation enters the chosen range. Radiation sensors can disable buildings when they detect dangerous levels of radiation.

Name: Radbolt Sensor
Description: Sends a Green Signal or a Red Signal when Radbolts detected enters the chosen range. Radbolt sensors can send a signal when a Radbolt passes over them.

Name: Signal Counter
Description: Counts how many times a Green Signal has been received up to a chosen number. When the chosen number is reached it sends a Green Signal until it receives another Green Signal, when it resets automatically and begins counting again. For numbers higher than ten connect multiple counters together.

Name: Automated Notifier
Description: Attach to sensors to send a notification when certain conditions are met. Notifications can be customized. Sends a notification when it receives a Green Signal.

Name: Hammer
Description: In its default orientation, the hammer strikes the building to the left when it receives a Green Signal. Each building has a unique sound when struck by the hammer. The hammer does no damage when it strikes. The hammer makes neat sounds when it strikes buildings.

Name: Automation Broadcaster
Description: Sends a Green Signal or a Red Signal to an Automation Receiver over vast distances in space. Both the Automation Broadcaster and the Automation Receiver must be exposed to space to function. Sends automation signals into space.

Name: Automation Receiver
Description: Receives a Green Signal or a Red Signal from an Automation Broadcaster over vast distances in space. Both the Automation Receiver and the Automation Broadcaster must be exposed to space to function. Receives automation signals from space.

Name: Ribbon Reader
Description: Reads a Green Signal or a Red Signal from the specified Bit of an Automation Ribbon onto an Automation Wire. Inputs the signal from a single Bit in an Automation Ribbon into an Automation Wire.

Name: Ribbon Writer
Description: Writes a Green Signal or a Red Signal to the specified Bit of an Automation Ribbon Automation Ribbon must be used as the output wire to avoid overloading. Translates the signal from an Automation Wire to a single Bit in an Automation Ribbon

Name: Weight Plate
Description: Sends a Green Signal when an object or Duplicant is placed atop of it. Cannot be triggered by Gas or Liquids. Weight plates can be used to turn on amenities only when Duplicants pass by.

Name: Duplicant Checkpoint
Description: Allows Duplicants to pass when receiving a Green Signal. Prevents Duplicants from passing when receiving a Red Signal. Checkpoints can be connected to automated sensors to determine when it's safe to enter.

Name: Space Scanner
Description: Sends a Green Signal to its automation circuit when it detects incoming objects from space. Can be configured to detect incoming meteor showers or returning space rockets. Networks of many scanners will scan more efficiently than one on its own.

Name: NOT Gate
Description: Outputs a Green Signal if the Input is receiving a Red Signal. Outputs a Red Signal when its Input is receiving a Green Signal. This gate reverses automation signals, turning a Green Signal into a Red Signal and vice versa.

Name: AND Gate
Description: Outputs a Green Signal when both Input A AND Input B are receiving Green. Outputs a Red Signal when even one Input is receiving Red. This gate outputs a Green Signal when both its inputs are receiving Green Signals at the same time.

Name: OR Gate
Description: Outputs a Green Signal if at least one of Input A OR Input B is receiving Green. Outputs a Red Signal when neither Input A or Input B are receiving Green. This gate outputs a Green Signal if receiving one or more Green Signals.

Name: BUFFER Gate
Description: Outputs a Green Signal if the Input is receiving a Green Signal. Continues sending a Green Signal for an amount of buffer time after the Input receives a Red Signal. This gate continues outputting a Green Signal for a short time after the gate stops receiving a Green Signal.

Name: FILTER Gate
Description: Only lets a Green Signal through if the Input has received a Green Signal for longer than the selected filter time. Will continue outputting a Red Signal if the Green Signal did not last long enough. This gate only lets a Green Signal through if its Input has received a Green Signal that lasted longer than the selected filter time.

Name: XOR Gate
Description: Outputs a Green Signal if exactly one of its Inputs is receiving Green. Outputs a Red Signal if both or neither Inputs are receiving a Green Signal. This gate outputs a Green Signal if exactly one of its Inputs is receiving a Green Signal.

Name: Memory Toggle
Description: Contains an internal Memory, and will output whatever signal is stored in that Memory. Signals sent to the Inputs only affect the Memory, and do not pass through to the Output. Sending a Green Signal to the Set Port (S) will set the memory to Green. Sending a Green Signal to the Reset Port (R) will reset the memory back to Red. A Memory stores a Green Signal received in the Set Port (S) until the Reset Port (R) receives a Green Signal.

Name: Signal Selector
Description: Select which one of four Input signals should be sent out the Output, using Control Inputs. Send a Green Signal or a Red Signal to the two Control Inputs to determine which Input is selected. Signal Selectors can be used to select which automation signal is relevant to pass through to a given circuit

Name: Signal Distributor
Description: Route a single Input signal out one of four possible Outputs, based on the selection made by the Control Inputs. Send a Green Signal or a Red Signal to the two Control Inputs to determine which Output is selected. Signal Distributors can be used to choose which circuit should receive a given automation signal.

Name: Auto-Sweeper
Description:
Automates Sweeping and Supplying errands by sucking up all nearby Debris.  Materials are automatically delivered to any Conveyor Loader, Conveyor Receptacle, storage, or buildings within range.
 An auto-sweeper's range can be viewed at any time by  \clicking\ on the building.

Name: Conveyor Rail
Description:
Transports Solid Materials on a track between Conveyor Loader and Conveyor Receptacle.  Can be run through wall and floor tile.
 Rails move materials where they'll be needed most, saving Duplicants the walk.

Name: Conveyor Bridge
Description:
Runs one Conveyor Rail section over another without joining them.  Can be run through wall and floor tile.
 Separating rail systems helps ensure materials go to the intended destinations.

Name: Conveyor Loader
Description:
Loads Solid Materials onto Conveyor Rail for transport.  Only loads the resources of your choosing.
 Material filters can be used to determine what resources are sent down the rail.

Name: Conveyor Receptacle
Description:
Unloads Solid Materials from a Conveyor Rail into storage.
 When materials reach the end of a rail they enter a receptacle to be used by Duplicants.

Name: Solid Filter
Description:
Separates one Solid Material from the conveyor, sending it into a dedicated Conveyor Rail.
 All solids are sent into the building's output conveyor, except the solid chosen for filtering.

Name: Conveyor Chute
Description:
Unloads Solid Materials from a Conveyor Rail onto the floor.
 When materials reach the end of a rail they are dropped back into the world.

Name: Conveyor Shutoff
Description:
Connects to an Automation grid to automatically turn Solid Material transport on or off.
 Automated conveyors save power and time by removing the need for Duplicant input.

Name: Conveyor Meter
Description:
Connects to an Automation grid to automatically turn material transfer off when the specified amount has passed through it.
 Conveyor Meters let an exact amount of materials pass through before shutting off.

Name: Conveyor Rail Germ Sensor
Description: Sends a Green Signal or a Red Signal based on the internal Germ count of the object on the rail. Germ sensors can help control automation behavior in the presence of germs.

Name: Conveyor Rail Element Sensor
Description: Sends a Green Signal when the selected item is detected on a rail. Element sensors can be used to detect the presence of a specific item on a rail.

Name: Conveyor Rail Thermo Sensor
Description: Sends a Green Signal or a Red Signal when rail contents enter the chosen Temperature range. Thermo sensors disable buildings when their rail contents reach a certain temperature.

Name: Robo-Miner
Description:
Automatically digs out all materials in a set range.
 A robo-miner's range can be viewed at any time by selecting the building.

Name: Solid Rocket Port Loader
Description:
Loads Solids to the storage of a linked rocket.  Automatically links when built to the side of a Rocket Platform or another Rocket Port.  Uses the solid material filters set on the rocket's cargo bays.
 Rockets must be landed to load or unload resources.

Name: Solid Rocket Port Unloader
Description:
Unloads Solids from the storage of a linked rocket.  Automatically links when built to the side of a Rocket Platform or another Rocket Port.  Uses the solid material filters set on this unloader.
 Rockets must be landed to load or unload resources.

Name: Telescope
Description:
Reveals visitable Planetoids in space.  Assigned Duplicants must possess the Astronomy skill.  Building must be exposed to space to function.
 Telescopes are necessary for studying space, allowing rocket travel to other worlds.

Name: Enclosed Telescope
Description:
Reveals visitable Planetoids in space... in comfort!  Assigned Duplicants must possess the Astronomy skill.  Excellent sunburn protection  (100%), partial Radiation protection (50%) .  Building must be exposed to space to function.
 Telescopes are necessary for studying space, allowing rocket travel to other worlds.

Name: Rocket Platform
Description:
Precursor to construction of all other Rocket modules.  Allows Rockets to launch from or land on the host Planetoid.  Automatically links up to Rocket Ports built to either side of the platform.
 A platform from which rockets can be launched and on which they can land.

Name: Gantry
Description:
Provides scaffolding across rocket modules to allow Duplicant access.
 A gantry can be built over rocket pieces where ladders and tile cannot.

Name: Rocket Control Station
Description:
Allows Duplicants to use pilot-operated rockets and control access to interior buildings.  Assigned Duplicants must have the Rocket Piloting skill.
 Someone needs to be around to jiggle the controls when the screensaver comes on.

Name: Power Outlet Fitting
Description:
Provides Power to connected buildings.  Pulls power from Battery Modules and Rocket Engines.  Must be built within the interior of a Rocket Module.
 Outlets conveniently power buildings inside a cockpit using their rocket's power stores.

Name: Liquid Intake Fitting
Description:
Allows Liquids to be pumped into rocket storage via Pipes.  Sends liquid to the first Rocket Module with available space.  Must be built within the interior of a Rocket Module.
 Begone, foul waters!

Name: Liquid Output Fitting
Description:
Allows Liquids to be drawn from rocket storage via Pipes.  Draws liquid from the first Rocket Module with the requested material.  Must be built within the interior of a Rocket Module.
 Now if only we had some water balloons...

Name: Gas Intake Fitting
Description:
Allows Gases to be pumped into rocket storage via Pipes.  Sends gas to the first Rocket Module with available space.  Must be built within the interior of a Rocket Module.
 It's basically central-vac.

Name: Gas Output Fitting
Description:
Allows Gases to be drawn from rocket storage via Pipes.  Draws gas from the first Rocket Module with the requested material.  Must be built within the interior of a Rocket Module.
 Refreshing breezes, on-demand.

Name: Conveyor Receptacle Fitting
Description:
Allows Solid Materials to be moved into rocket storage via Conveyor Rails.  Sends solid material to the first Rocket Module with available space.  Must be built within the interior of a Rocket Module.
 Why organize your shelves when you can just shove everything in here?

Name: Conveyor Loader Fitting
Description:
Allows Solid Materials to be moved out of rocket storage via Conveyor Rails.  Draws solid material from the first Rocket Module with the requested material.  Must be built within the interior of a Rocket Module.
 For accessing your stored luggage mid-flight.

Name: Starmap Location Sensor
Description: Send Green Signals at the chosen starmap locations and Red Signals everywhere else. Starmap Location sensors can signal when a spacecraft is at a certain location

Name: Interplanetary Launcher
Description:
Launches Interplanetary Payloads between Planetoids.  Payloads can contain Solid, Liquid, or Gas materials.  Cannot transport Duplicants.
 It's tempting to climb inside but trust me... don't.

Name: Payload Opener
Description:
Unpacks Interplanetary Payloads delivered by Duplicants.  Automatically separates Solid, Liquid, and Gas materials and distributes them to the appropriate systems.
 Payload openers can be hooked up to conveyors, plumbing and ventilation for improved sorting.

Name: Targeting Beacon
Description:
Guides Interplanetary Payloads and Orbital Cargo Modules to land nearby.  Interplanetary Payloads must be launched from a Interplanetary Launcher.
 Microtarget where your Interplanetary Payload lands on a Planetoid surface.

Name: Radiation Lamp
Description:
Emits Radiation when Powered that can be collected by a Radbolt Generator.
 Duplicants can become sick if exposed to radiation without protection.

Name: Research Reactor
Description:
Uses Enriched Uranium to produce Radiation for Radbolt production.  Generates a massive amount of Heat. Overheating will result in an explosive meltdown.
 Radbolt generators and reflectors make radiation useable by other buildings.

Name: Radbolt Generator
Description:
Attracts nearby Radiation to generate Radbolts.  Emits generated Radbolts in the direction of your choosing when the set Radbolt threshold is reached.  Radbolts collected will rapidly decay while this building is disabled.
 Radbolts are necessary for producing Materials Science research.

Name: Radbolt Reflector
Description:
Receives and redirects Radbolts from Radbolt Generators.
 We were all out of mirrors.

Name: Radbolt Chamber
Description: Stores Radbolts in a high-energy state, ready for transport. Requires a Green Signal to release radbolts from storage when the Radbolt threshold is reached. Radbolts in storage will rapidly decay while this building is disabled. Particles packed up and ready to go.

Name: Radbolt Joint Plate
Description:
Receives Radbolts from Radbolt Generators and directs them through walls. All other materials and elements will be blocked from passage.
 Allows Radbolts to pass through walls.

Name: Printing Pod
Description:
An exceptionally advanced bioprinter of unknown origin.  It periodically produces new Duplicants or care packages containing resources.
 New Duplicants come out here, but thank goodness, they never go back in.

Name: Anti Entropy Thermo-Nullifier
Description: A self-sustaining machine powered by what appears to be refined Neutronium.  Absorbs and neutralizes Heat energy when provided with piped Hydrogen.

Name: Neural Vacillator
Description:
A massive synthetic brain, suspended in saline solution.

There is a chair attached to the device with room for one person.
